p: Myrianthus arboreus P. Beauv. is a dioecious shrub or tree and belongs to the family Cecropiaceae. It is found growing in forest zones of tropical Africa, including Ghana. Extracts of the leaves and leafy shoots of Myrianthus arboreus are used in the treatment of dysentery, wounds, diarrhea, boils, dysmenorrhea and incipient hernia [ 7]. The oil from the leaves is mainly made up of linoleic acids, which maintains the skinâ€™s impermeability to water [ 7]. This plant has been observed to exhibit activities against some pathogens including Plasmodia spp., Mycobacteria spp. and Trypanosoma spp. [ 7].
